title: City watchdog frustrated by ministers' inaction on rogue investments
text:
The City watchdog has expressed its dismay over ministers' refusal to establish a formal system to aid its fight against rogue investments.

The Government last week rejected proposals to implement new rules that would allow the regulator, the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA), to ask for greater powers. At present, there is no formal structure for the FCA to ask ministers for additional controls, even if the watchdog spots a gap in its framework that is being exploited by rogue firms.

The Treasury Committee, a prominent group of MPs, had suggested the creation of a new system to prevent consumer harm.
